toiminta.title: ACTIVITIES
toiminta.description: KIDE grants annual targeted grants for fiction writers' tools and travel required for fictional work. The application period for grants is annually in March and October.
toiminta.info: KIDE offers work residencies for Finnish and Swedish-language fiction writers. Residence activities are currently in Athens.
toiminta.info2: KIDE implements training that maintains writers' professional skills. KIDE courses are announced in member letters of the Finnish Writers' Union and Finlands svenska författareförening.

apurahat.title: GRANTS
apurahat.description: KIDE grants annual targeted grants for fiction writers' tools and travel required for fictional work. The application period for grants is annually in March and October.
apurahat.info: The grant recipient must submit a report on the use of the grant to the Literature Promotion Centre through the grant system.

valtuuskunta.title: COUNCIL
valtuuskunta.description: The activities of the Literature Promotion Centre KIDE are administered by a council elected by the Board of the Finnish Writers' Union.
list_items: Anne Helttunen, mother tongue teacher and non-fiction writer
Ville Hytönen, Chairman of the Council
valtuuskunta.info: The Executive Director of the Finnish Writers' Union acts as the secretary of the council.

kirjailijakuvia.title: AUTHOR IMAGES
kirjailijakuvia.description: Literature Promotion Centre KIDE produced the Author Images documentary series from 1988 to 2012.
kirjailijakuvia.p1: In the series, domestic authors representing different literary genres tell about their work, influences, and production themselves, each in their own way. The series introduces both Finnish and Swedish-speaking authors.
kirjailijakuvia.p2: A total of 49 documentaries appeared in the series.
kirjailijakuvia.p3: Libraries can both borrow documentaries and show them at free public events. Documentaries are also suitable for supporting mother tongue and literature teaching.
kirjailijakuvia.p4: The documentaries are about 20–40 minutes long. Documentaries can be purchased and borrowed from the Writers' Union office.
